means: 迦太基（非洲北部，今突尼斯的奴隶制城邦，腓尼基人所建，公元146年被罗马帝国所灭，见Punic Wars）

sentence.Network_en: The Vandals from Carthage took and sacked Rome in 455.
sentence.Network_cn: 来自迦太基的汪达尔人于455年侵占并洗劫了罗马.

sentence.Network_en: It'soon outgrew Carthage and became the largest city of the western world.
sentence.Network_cn: 它很快取代了迦太基成为西方的第一大城市.

sentence.Network_en: The people of Carthage are afraid, and well they may be.
sentence.Network_cn: 迦太基人害怕了, 他们的害怕是有道理的.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 迦太基系腓尼基人的殖民地，因罗马人称迦太基(Carthage)人为“布匿”(Punici)，故名。第一、二次布匿战争是作战双方为争夺西地中海 …

means.word_mean: 1. an ancient city state on the north African coast near modern Tunis; founded by Phoenicians; destroyed and rebuilt by Romans; razed by Arabs in 697

auth_sentence.content: The city of Carthage, near the site of present-day Tunis, becomes a naval power.
